Design System Component: App Bars Dynamic Island

When to Use:

* Use this component when you want to create a navigation bar that is fixed to the top or bottom of the screen, and can expand or collapse to show more options.
* Use this component in mobile or web applications where there is a need for a dynamic navigation bar that adapts to the user's needs.

Anatomy:

* The App Bars Dynamic Island component consists of a fixed navigation bar at the top or bottom of the screen.
* The navigation bar can have a logo, a title, and one or more options (e.g. buttons, links, etc.).
* When the user taps or clicks on an option, the navigation bar can expand to show more options.

Placement:

* The App Bars Dynamic Island component should be placed at the top or bottom of the screen, depending on the design and user experience requirements.
* The component should be fixed in place so that it is always visible when the user scrolls the content.

Content:

* The App Bars Dynamic Island component should have a clear and concise title that describes the purpose of the app or the current screen.
* The navigation options should be clearly labeled and easy to understand.
* The navigation options should be grouped into logical categories, with the most important options placed prominently.

Behaviors with States and Interactions:

* The App Bars Dynamic Island component should have a default state where the navigation bar is collapsed and only the most important options are visible.
* When the user taps or clicks on an option, the navigation bar should expand to show more options.
* When the user taps or clicks on an option, the app should navigate to the corresponding screen or take the appropriate action.
* When the user scrolls the content, the navigation bar should remain fixed in place.
